definition: my meager sensibilities/blushing face/please do it for my sake (i.e. to save my face)(humble)
meager/slight/weak/ungenerous or unkind/frivolous/to despise/to belittle/to look down on/to approach or near
see 薄荷[bo4 he5]
surname Bo
thin/cold in manner/indifferent/weak/light/infertile
face/side/surface/aspect/top/classifier for flat surfaces such as drums, mirrors, flags etc

sentences.english: Father, for my sake, knight him this day.
sentences.chinese: 父王，看我的薄面，今日冊封他爲騎士吧。

sentences.english: Doctor Xie all ought give thin side for several cents.
sentences.chinese: 謝大夫總該給幾分薄面的。

definition: lit. not for the monk's sake but for the Buddha's sake (idiom)/fig. (to do sth for sb) out of deference to sb else
pinyin: bu4 kan4 seng1 mian4 kan4 fo2 mian4

definition: feelings and sensibilities/sentiment and face/sensitivity to other's feelings
(in the expression 看在…的份上) for the sake of .../considering ...
to be generous (idiom)/to be magnanimous/Give me a break!
to show deference to sb by obliging them (or by obliging sb associated with them)
outer surface/outside/honor/reputation/face (as in "losing face")/self-respect/feelings/(medicinal) powder
mutual affection/friendship
face
open the net on one side (idiom); let the caged bird fly/to give one's opponent a way out/lenient treatment
to apologize/apology
to offend sb/to give offense/to displease
to apologize
unable to tell good from bad (idiom)/undiscriminating
to offer an apology/to make amends
my meager gift (humble)
to push sb too far/to go too far (in oppressing people)
